history.question: Were you in the library around 9pm last night?
history.feedback: I was already back at my apartment by then, trying to collect my thoughts.

history.question: Did you borrow any antique items from the library recently?
history.feedback: No, I did not borrow any antique items from the library; I was there to discuss a deal, not to borrow anything.

history.question: Did you have any reason to be jealous of Jonathan Whitmore?
history.feedback: Jealous? Not really, we weren't even close friends. Why do you ask?

history.question: What were you doing near the abandoned warehouse at midnight last night?
history.feedback: I was just walking my dog near the park, which is close to the warehouse. Why do you ask?

history.question: Did you know Jonathan Harper?
history.feedback: Yes, Jonathan Harper was like a mentor to me. He not only gave me opportunities to showcase my work but also mentored me in photography and storytelling.

history.question: Do you have any recent conflicts or disagreements with Jonathan Harper?
history.feedback: No, I don't have any recent conflicts or disagreements with Jonathan Harper. Our interactions were always professional.

history.question: Have you ever harbored any grudges against Jonathan Harper?
history.feedback: Not really, Jonathan and I had our disagreements, but overall, I didn't hold any serious grudges against him.

history.question: Did you have any disputes with Jonathan Harper before this incident?
history.feedback: No, we always got along great, like brothers.

history.question: Did you see anyone suspicious near the abandoned warehouse around midnight last night?
history.feedback: Not really, it was pretty quiet. Why do you think someone would be suspicious there?

history.question: Did you visit the abandoned warehouse on the night of the murder?
history.feedback: Yes, I went to the warehouse to meet Jonathan and discuss the photographs for his story. It was our usual spot for such meetings.

history.question: Did you accompany Evelyn to the abandoned warehouse on the night of the murder?
history.feedback: No, I did not accompany Evelyn to the abandoned warehouse that night. She works with me, but we didn't meet there together.

history.question: Do you have an alibi for the time of the murder?
history.feedback: I was at the warehouse, meeting with Jonathan to discuss important information. I left around 10:00 PM and can confirm that I was alone until I returned home.
